plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A small perennial flowering plant that often blooms in late winter to early spring, producing cup-shaped flowers that close at night.
plants.location: Temperate regions of Europe and North America
plants.funFact: Crocuses are among the first flowers to bloom, sometimes even poking through snow.

plants.name: Prunus mume
plants.description: A deciduous tree known for its beautiful and fragrant early spring blossoms that bloom in late winter to early spring before leaves appear.
plants.funFact: Ume blossoms are celebrated in East Asia as a symbol of perseverance and hope.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A small ornamental tree with striking bright red flowers blooming in the Southern Hemisphere's late summer to early autumn, which corresponds to February in places like Argentina and Brazil.
plants.funFact: The cockspur coral tree is the national flower of Argentina and Uruguay.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub famous for its large, showy flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring in temperate climates.
plants.location: East Asia and widely cultivated in temperate climates worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellia oil from seeds has been historically used for hair care and cooking.
